meanings.definition: A mark of disgrace or infamy
meanings.sent1: The criminal bore the stigme of his past actions on his face.
meanings.sent2: The stigme of being a liar can harm one's reputation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the stigme of clumsiness followed him everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The stigme of failure weighed heavily on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The stigme of betrayal left a lasting scar on their friendship.

meanings.definition: A mark made by pricking or branding
meanings.sent1: The cattle rancher placed a stigme on each cow for identification.
meanings.sent2: The ancient warriors bore stigmes on their bodies as symbols of their bravery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to have a stigme from a secret society.
meanings.sent4: The stigme of ownership was clearly visible on the valuable artifact.
meanings.sent5: The stigme of the artist's signature added value to the painting.

meanings.definition: A mark or sign of a particular quality or characteristic
meanings.sent1: The flower's unique scent was a stigme of its species.
meanings.sent2: The chef considered the perfect grill marks a stigme of his skill.
meanings.sent3: The detective saw the mysterious symbol as a stigme left by the culprit.
meanings.sent4: The stigme of excellence was evident in her flawless performance.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone bore a stigme of authenticity that set it apart from imitations.
